messages: eaa6e1da0eef72dfb27f73d1b6493b8f (23:44): :O
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (23:58): hparker, ill take those parts off your hands (and didnt you have or work with one already?)
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (23:59): Just sold it.. I had a "few" spares

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:00): I'm cleaning out my office today.. Didn't realize how much radio junk I had till it started ending up in one pile... Then there's a pile in another room... And the garage... And the back of the truck... ;)
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:02): shouldnt that go to the new owner, ir is this now "orphand" (sp) gear?
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:02): how good with electronics are you hparker?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:02): They only bought what was in place... And replacing a bunch of it
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:03): you were 88b/g/a yea?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:03): Eggplant: 20 years ago, real good... Been almost that long since I've really messed with it though
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:03): Just 11b, and a 11a backhaul
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:03): ah fooies, ive got what i think is a "simple" Q, but want to double check my thoughts
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:04): you know anything about Vregs from cars?
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:04): they have a simple setup to control the field voltage on the alt via a sense wire
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:04): I was an auto tech for 12 years.. That was between electronic repair and computer repair ;)
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:05): ha! sweet, so you at least have a clue =)
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:05): I am wondering if I coudl use the field wires to charge a battery directly, use a diode to isolate the field from the sense wire
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:05): Cars I still play with
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:06): Cause im putting up a 2nd win gen site and have a few car regs (older ones) on hand
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:06): why go buy new gear if you have something that will work =)
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:07): I think you'd over charge the batteries
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:08): even tho it has a sense wire that should cause the field coil (volts or amps?) to drop as charge level rises?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:08): I've done single wire setups with older GM alternators that worked fine
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:08): signle wire? hows that work?

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:09): I forget the specifics, but... On the older GM alternators, there's the 2 wire plug.. You just strap on of them (the sense wire I'd guess) to the output lug that goes to the battery
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:10): Last one I did would of been aroud '90 when I owned my garage
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:10): sounds more like the field coil and the output coil
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:11): the reg has the sense wire that drops the field voltage as charge comes up
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:11): but then there are all kinds of setups im sure,
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:11): thats what has me looking for other help ;)

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:11): Worked sweet... I was driving a '57 Chevy truck at the time with a generator in it.. Small town, never long enough trips to charge the battery.. Everything was fine after I put an alternator in it
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:12): i <think> i would be fine if i kept a good load on the battery setup, but not 100% on that
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:12): ahh yea ive heard alot of stories from my stepdad and his family about doing that to farm tractors, cats, pickups, etc
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:14): I still tinker a bit... Putting together a 360 for my '74 Road Runner... '74 Triumph Bonny 750 chopper to get running
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:15): well fooies, guess i should hook it up and watch the field coil voltage
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:15): if i had a way to ID the reg and obtain specs i would know for sure
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:16): hparker: I need your 360.  Cough it up
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:17): have some bad rf neighboors?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:17): J4k3: No.... Early 70s block, 913 J heads (340 6 pack)... 6 pack intake and Carter AVS... ;)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:17): hparker: it'd fit!
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:17): Dodge was still selling LA blocks until 2001 or 2002.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:18): J4k3: I've got a 318 in the garage you can have though ;)
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:18): J4k3, do you need more HP, MPG, or "run them down" speed?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:18): Eggplant: enough-torque-to-make-it-up-a-hill-without-downshifting-to-third
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:18): Eggplant: also... my 318 sounds like its about ready to come apart.  I've already turned one rod into an S.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:18): J4k3: 14 year old boy gets his lerners permit this summer... Has thoughts of driving the RR after I get it on the road ;)
e2b262fcacd6453be52690a65df28b65 (00:18): that doesnt sound good
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:19): hparker: 15 degrees of timing retard first :)

60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:19): J4k3: The only way I got my '95 Ram 4wd to not want to downshift all the time was to put in a Mopar Performance computer.. I've since pulled it so I could go back to buring regular :/
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:19): or use kite string on the throttle
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:21): my first vehicle was a 92 Exploder...  160 hp, 250 ft/lbs, and that was about 75% too much for a first vehicle.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:22): I just bought the wife an '03 Caravan.. I think he'll look good in it ;)

df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:22): when i try to use dhcpcd in debian to get an ip after associating with an ap, i get the error "wifi0: unknown hardware address type 801". could the dhcpcd be too old?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:22): What in debian isn't too old? ;)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:23): hahaha...  Then again, the most comfortable 'high school' car of anyone I knew was a 91 Aerostar Eddie Bauer 4.0L.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:25): Oh, if he wants something to drive to school, he'd best be getting a job ;)
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:25): in wireless networks, is line of sight more important than recieve sensitivity and power?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:26): LOS is important, power and receive sensitivity come in play more at distances, or noisy enviroments
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:27): would there be much range difference between the senao 200mw cards and cisco aironet 350 cards?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:28): haha hparker...
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:28): oh yeah, I gotta go buy that 84 accord today
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:28): (its for a friend)
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:32): Fluten: I forget what the 350s put out
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:33): How far are you trying to go?
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:33): a few blocks
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:33): trying to find a card that can pick up access points from a long way away
abe59155aa41ae19e4ea964e9dd4b200 (00:33): http://www.bagdadsoftware.de")
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:34): do most residential access points only put out 30mw?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:35): No idea on that as I've only messed with a few of them
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:35): theres no point in being louder
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:35): arent the recieve sensitivites on the 2wire aps low?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:36): 2wire units are often pushed to the point the transmitters clip
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:36): No idea, I just know them because of another ISP I do work for fights with them.. Seems SBC uses them with their DSL giveaways

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:37): the FCC needs to be contacted about that, because nothing 2wire sells is rated for more than 20 dBm on their fccid, but I keep hearing reports of 26 dBm being set.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:37): Like they'll do anything...
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:37): hparker: they will if its widespread and obvious.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:38): Yabut, you're going to have to do the leg work to get them interested
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:38): yeah... its getting easier at the FCC (fewer pockets to fill)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:39): trust me, I've had an FCC Cessna buzz my tower, you *can* get things investigated.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:39): yeah, I never heard anything about it, since we're legal
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:41): my guess is Nalcom called...  they've got shit going up just north of here
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:41): they're just too stupid to realize they installed their equipment in a 200 ft deep HOLE on the side of a 110' tall water tower.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:42): they've already publicly blamed some other ISP for their shit performance..  I guess geography is beyond their mental capabilities.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:42): its bad when I'm 15 miles away and can barely see the top light on the railroad's tower over there (250')
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:43): There was an ISP in Garden City that blamed the City's backhauls for his bad performance... Funny how people blame others because they have no clue
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:44): I pity the fools...  trying to peddle $350 installs.. every square inch of that POP's coverage has cheap $0/setup $30/mo dsl.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:44): I'm coming to the point that I suspect everything that nvidia sells is flawed
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (00:46): All hardware is flawed... It all sux...
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:46): this piece of shit can't even burn a cd at 16x without losing its buffer
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:47): it *claims* to be in DMA mode, but runs like its in PIO mode 0 :P
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:47): I think I'll replace the caps on an old KT266A board and roll with that instead.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:47): at least Via's crap gets support.
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (00:58): does "Access Point: 44:44:44:44:44:44" mean that a card hasn't associated with an access point?
30e7fe55b659719e62363003017e04ba (01:00): thats a bogus mac
30e7fe55b659719e62363003017e04ba (01:00): weird one to use, but bogus
71c7045c46e530098391b6a56926d30d (01:03): Fluten - if you mean in linux
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (01:06): do most cards in linux automatically associate with an ap?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:07): depends on a lot of variables
f3dddede7cafdc2312155376d854dfa0 (01:07): Fluten: depends on distro, driver, your setup, etc
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:07): madwifi-old does by default
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:07): bring up the interface, the first thing it hears is its new friend.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:07): unless you set the essid before you bring it up
f3dddede7cafdc2312155376d854dfa0 (01:07): J4k3: not on my system ;-)
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (01:07): i have a senao card and have been having trouble getting it to connect to anything
df4b20f75e989999e8c112527c1b7d98 (01:08): but i set up a card a year ago using ndiswrapper, and all i had to do was load the driver, and run dhcpcd
f3dddede7cafdc2312155376d854dfa0 (01:08): Fluten: and that was a different driver, with a different setup.... see how things are different...
